instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A crashes mid boot with colored artifacts on screen
threads.message:
Hi, got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A crashes mid boot with colored artifacts on screen.

Things ive tried:

1. Swapping SSD: Same thing
2. Disconnecting everything but LCD: Same thing.
3. Reflowing RAM just in case: same thing
4. Booting in safe mode: it boots allright and everything works as intented

Diagnostics only say that theres may be something wrong with the fan PPF004

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A crashes mid boot with colored artifacts on screen
threads.message:
"Booting in safe mode: it boots allright and everything works as intented"
iGPU problem; graphics driver is not loaded in safe mode...
